alert.note: Alert for Coastal Hancock; Coastal Washington (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Watch issued April 18 at 5:32AM EDT until April 19 at 3:00PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Up to 3 feet of storm surge is expected around the time of high tide Tuesday afternoon. This will combine with high astronomical tides and building seas to produce the threat of minor to moderate coastal flooding around the time of high tide. * WHERE...Coastal Hancock and Coastal Washington Counties. * WHEN...Tuesday afternoon around the time of high tide. High tide at Bar Harbor is at 1:27 p.m. and at Machias is at 1:36 p.m. * IMPACTS...Roads along the shoreline may be flooded and closed. Low-lying property including homes, businesses, and some critical infrastructure may experience minor to moderate flooding around the time of high tide. This includes Machias. Shoreline erosion is likely at locations such as Rogue Bluffs.
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
